main event: On 7 December 1957 in Shreveport, Louisiana, a civilian observed an oval object, the size of a B-29, silver in color and surrounded by vapor. The object had no exhaust or sound and was observed for 3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as oval, the size of a B-29, and silver in color, with no exhaust or sound.
It was observed for 3 minutes and was surrounded by vapor.
The report suggests that the object was concluded to be a balloon or possibly an aircraft, with insufficient data for proper evaluation.

A separate observation on the same day described a cigar-rocket shaped object, silver, glowing all over with a number of knobs on the side, traveling fast, with no exhaust or sound, and appearing to disappear to the east.
The observation indicated insufficient information for proper evaluation, leaving the conclusion inconclusive.
